Description: Rim and body sherd of North Ionian Late Wild Goat Style pottery plate or stemmed dish; white slip; slightly thickened rim, glazed; on floor, from outside: open cable pattern; two bands; lotus flower and bud frieze with added red; exterior: seven narrow and wide black bands.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Classical Archaeology, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.867)
